result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to revocation, With credit for 18 days time served. STRAIGHT TIME.

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered all costs and surcharges due by September 20, 2024 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit to be applied.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 1 with, with credit for 18 DAYS time served. STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Alvarez

records.addlTxt: Order to Cancel Warrant signed and filed.  bm

Defendant not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Defendant bench warranted on May 3, 2022.  Matter returned to court on June 16, 2022 and the warrant was never cancelled.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Angel Alvarez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Angel Alvarez.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing this date.  Defendant consents to this matter being heard via Zoom.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNTS 3 & 4:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 3 & 4 dismissed and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing.  State compliant with victim notification.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to ANY OTHER SENTENCE AND CONSECUTIVE TO REVOCATION, with credit for 18 DAYS time served.  STRAIGHT TIME

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered all costs and surcharges due by September 20, 2024 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit to be applied.  


AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 with, with credit for 18 DAYS time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered all costs and surcharges due by September 20, 2024 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit to be applied.  

Defendant NOT required to register as a sex offender.

Appellate rights given to defendant
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  bm
Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed. bm

Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing this date.  Defendant in custody not produced.  Court signed Video Writ this date for Defendant's appearance on the next date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order to Have Defendant Appear via Zoom for Plea and Sentencing September 20, 2022 at 9:00 am.  Video Writ signed and filed this date.  bm

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Angel Alvarez not in court, in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Erin Michelle Karshen for Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Defense requested an adjournment due to not knowing Defendant's prison location.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Alvarez in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Angel Alvarez in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angel Alvarez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
